review_title: Impact to the world, but hard work.
pros:

review_title: Great company leading a new emerging market
pros: The company prides itself on being agile and able to pivot and make necessary changes quickly and efficiently. All levels of management are aligned with the overall business objectives and therefore there is no second guessing what Brightidea is striving to achieve. As an employee, you have easy and direct access to everyone in the company from the CEO on down to discuss and develop what you are working on. The vibe in the San Francisco office is pretty casual and communal; everyone is pretty friendly, works well together and knows how to have some fun.
cons: Each department sits together, works well cross-functionally and is extremely driven; it just takes a little extra effort to know what’s going on with one team if you sit three blocks down, but that’s why we have team meetings every month.
advice_to_mgmt: : I think that Brightidea continues to position itself ahead of the market. In the years to come, it will be important that we continue to deliver a best in class solution. One team lunch a week to give teams that don’t usually work closely together get the opportunity to interact more.

pros: Genuinely nice people; interesting product category (helping large companies innovate and compete with more nimble start-ups); cool, fun offices; fully stocked kitchens.
cons: Vacuum at the top. CEO is also Acting VP Product and Acting VP of Marketing. Obviously, one person cannot do all three jobs well. COO is a micro-managing control freak. That management style was necessary when the company was small. He has failed to scale with the business, which is now almost 50 people.
advice_to_mgmt: Bring in a strong CEO and let Matt be VP Product, which is his first love. Let Vin be CFO, where he can do spreadsheets all day and not manage people.

pros: Fast paced and never a dull moment, You are never lacking anything to do.
cons: Unfortunately that boils down to the CEO making hasty half baked ideas into software requests that never seem to get finished. BUT DO IT NOW! The codebase is a nightmare mix of code technologies that I am actually amazed is somehow running (most of the time).
advice_to_mgmt: Stop farming out the important parts of your code to India to work on, it's horrible to work on.

review_title: A company full of rockstars with something new and exciting around every corner.
pros: It's been an amazing ride so far. I am surrounded by a team of talented hard-working people. I learn new things frequently, and i'm constantly challenged to solve new interesting problems. I have been able to grow a lot while working here, both as a developer, and in my own career. I'm pushed to do great things. The location is fantastic. The opportunities have been so far above and beyond my own expectations. The future consistently looks very bright. And it's by far the best job I've ever had.
cons: There really aren't any. We work hard, it's definitely not a place for the lazy, but it's refreshing being part of a team where everyone works hard and cares about the product.

review_title: Directionless and lazy. Lackluster product built on 12 year old spaghetti code.
pros: A few nice people and the location was nice
cons: My manager runs around like a coked up ferret micromanaging the smallest part of my day. The work involves nothing but plugging holes in ancient legacy code.
advice_to_mgmt: You aren't a startup anymore and you have a working product...How about spending some time making it run on technology from this decade and stop slapping on new half-ass features.
